text.text_translated:
Zoos have an important job.  
They protect animal types that are in trouble.  
In the wild these animals often cannot find a mate.  
They also face people who hunt and lose their homes.  
Zoos give them a safe place to live.  
Zoos also run baby programs.  
They work with other zoos around the world.  
These programs help the animals have babies safely.  
The babies keep the animal families healthy and strong.  
This protects the animal types for later.  
Zoo‑born animals can be released back into the wild.  
They add new families to the wild groups.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Zoos have an important job.  
They help animals that are very rare.  
In the wild these animals have few partners.  
They also face hunters and lose their homes.  
They also have danger from other animals.  
Zoos give them a safe place to live.  
Zoos give them a safe place to have babies.  
Zoos work with other zoos around the world.  
This is a baby program with many zoos.  
The program helps keep animals from being all from the same family.  
When animals are too similar, they can have problems.  
The program adds new families to the group.  
Zoo‑born animals can be released into the wild.  
This adds new families to wild animals.
